title: Progressive Mixed Hearing Loss with Chronic Ear Disease
chief_complaint: My hearing has been getting worse over the last 4 months, especially in my right ear, and the ringing sounds like insects which keeps me awake. I also have dizziness every day and white fluid draining from my right ear.

problem_summary.onset: Progression of symptoms over the past 4 months.
problem_summary.course: Progressive hearing loss and increased tinnitus.
problem_summary.laterality: Bilateral, worse in the right ear.
problem_summary.associated_symptoms: Tinnitus (insect sounds), bilateral intermittent otalgia, daily dizziness (lasting seconds), white otorrhea (right ear).
problem_summary.functional_impact: Tinnitus is affecting sleep; hearing loss is progressing.

history.present_illness: Patient reports progression of hearing loss and increased tinnitus (described as insect sounds) in the right ear over the past 4 months. She experiences bilateral intermittent otalgia and daily dizziness lasting a few seconds, with and without head movement. White otorrhea has been present in the right ear for the last few months.
history.otologic_history: History of chronic ear disease. Previous right tympanomastoidectomy and ossicular chain reconstruction. Previous left tympanoplasty.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear: Moderate to moderately severe mixed loss (250-500 Hz), rising to moderate (1-2 kHz), sloping to severe mixed loss (3-8 kHz). Left ear: Moderate rising to slight mixed loss (250-1000 Hz), sloping to mild SNHL (2-3 kHz), then moderately severe mixed loss (4-8 kHz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: SRT results were in agreement with PTA. Word recognition scores (WRS) indicated only slight difficulty in the ability to recognize speech at suprathreshold levels.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.key_findings: Immittance testing could not be measured due to previous otosurgery.

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient presents with asymmetric, bilateral mixed hearing loss, worse in the right ear. The configuration is complex, generally showing better thresholds in the mid-frequencies and sloping in the high frequencies. Speech recognition remains good bilaterally when speech is loud enough. The presence of air-bone gaps indicates a conductive component overlaying sensorineural loss, consistent with her history of chronic ear disease and surgeries.
counseling_points: You have an active infection in your right ear that requires immediate medical treatment; please take the prescribed medication and follow up in 1 month.
Your hearing test shows a 'mixed' hearing loss in both ears, meaning there is both a nerve component and a mechanical component (related to your middle ear history).
Once the infection is cleared and medical clearance is obtained, we can evaluate you for hearing aids to help with communication and potentially mask the tinnitus.
Because of your dizziness and ear history, hearing protection in loud noise is very important to preserve your remaining hearing.
notes_for_actor: Portray fatigue due to sleep disturbance from the tinnitus ('insect sounds').
Mention the dizziness casually but note it happens every day.
You are aware of your chronic ear issues but are concerned about the recent white drainage and worsening hearing.
